result.execSummary:
The defendant Dennis Ray Shadle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution in the amount of $1,623.53 payable to West Allis Police Department to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds balance to be paid during term of supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid prior to any court costs, fees and assessments.

Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.  If defendant has already provided a DNA sample, Court waives defendant needing to provide a DNA surcharge and pay the related surcharges.

08-27-15/ William W Brash
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect a TOTAL of 209 days of sentence credit.

Consecutive to: consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 209 days time served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications as prescribed by therapist  and cooperate with any treatment and follow-up treatment with diagnosis.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dennis Ray Shadle

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per clerical error (A.D.), credit amount in "comments" showing 209 per Order signed on 8/27/2015
Reflects 08-27-15 Court order for 209 TOTAL days of sentence credit
Amending Judgment of Conviction signed and filed.  Copy sent to Dodge Correctional and State.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
DOC request to review sentence credit.
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 1 DISMISSED to be used as a READ-IN on COUNT 2.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY to COUNT 2 and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty on COUNT 2 as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 7 1/2 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of  4 1/2 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of  3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 219 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution in the amount of $1,623.53 payable to West Allis Police Department to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds balance to be paid during term of supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid prior to any court costs, fees and assessments. 
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment.  If defendant has already provided a DNA sample, Court waives defendant needing to provide a DNA surcharge and pay the related surcharges.  
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications as prescribed by therapist  and cooperate with any treatment and follow-up treatment with diagnosis -AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Pretrial Incarceration Credit form

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Dennis Ray Shadle not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is in special needs section in the jail - suicide watch.  Defendant needs to be brought up separately from another other defendants  and not allowed to be left in the bull-pen.  Matter to be called immediately on the next court date.  Parties agreed to be here promptly at 8:30 a.m.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Dennis Ray Shadle not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court involved in a Jury Trial.  Matter rescheduled.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Case remains calendared for plea/sentencing July 13, 2015.
records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt: Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in custody.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties here on State's motion challenging the finding of competency of the defendant. Sworn for the state: Dr. Robert Rawski. Parties rest. Court finds the defendant to be competent and orders the record to reflect as such.
Branch 21 is in jury trial and is unable to hear this matter.  Branch 38 will now hear this matter.  Parties notified, and case sent forthwith.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Dennis Ray Shadle not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared via telephone for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for hearing on the doctor's report. Due to court calendar congestion, the case is not able to be heard today.  A new date was selected. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for return on doctors report.  The defense does not dispute the findings, however the State contests the report.  Proceedings remain suspended. Defendant remanded.  Case adjourned for contested doctors report hearing.  A plea and sentencing date was also selected. Case adjourned to Branch 21.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
report from Dr. Robert Rawski received and filed.
Signed and filed.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Dennis Ray Shadle not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant's appearance is waived.  Defendant in custody on suicide watch.  Defense raises competency pursuant to.  Court ordered defendant be examined by the Forensic Unit of Milwaukee County.  Court ordered defendant remanded into the custody of the Sheriff's Department.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Order for Examination under Wisc. Stat. 971.16 (Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect), signed and filed.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Dennis Ray Shadle not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter before the Court for Status conference.  Appearance of the defendant waived for todays proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  The parties have no preference as to examination doctor.  The Court orders the defendant to be examined under Wisc. Stat. 971.16.  Wisconsin Forensic Unit notified this date telephonically.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer in court, defendant Dennis Ray Shadle not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations.  Defense needs additional time to review discovery materials and offer; request for status date granted.  Status conference scheduled for March 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in custody.  Michael Lonski for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Dennis Ray Shadle in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
